00046 static void
00047 fillCineonFileInfo(CineonFile* cineon, CineonFileInformation* fileInfo, const char* filename) {
00048 
00049     time_t fileClock;
00050     struct tm* fileTime;
00051 
00052     fileInfo->magic_num = htonl(CINEON_FILE_MAGIC);
00053     fileInfo->image_offset = htonl(cineon->imageOffset);
00054     fileInfo->gen_hdr_size = htonl(
00055         sizeof(CineonFileInformation) +
00056         sizeof(CineonImageInformation) +
00057         sizeof(CineonFormatInformation) +
00058         sizeof(CineonOriginationInformation));
00059     fileInfo->ind_hdr_size = 0;
00060     fileInfo->user_data_size = 0;
00061     fileInfo->file_size = htonl(cineon->imageOffset + cineon->height * cineon->lineBufferLength);
00062     strcpy(fileInfo->vers, "V4.5");
00063     strncpy(fileInfo->file_name, filename, 99);
00064     fileInfo->file_name[99] = 0;
00065 
00066     fileClock = time(0);
00067     fileTime = localtime(&fileClock);
00068     strftime(fileInfo->create_date, 12, "%Y:%m:%d", fileTime);
00069     /* Question: is %Z in strftime guaranteed to return 3 chars? */
00070     strftime(fileInfo->create_time, 12, "%H:%M:%S%Z", fileTime);
00071     fileInfo->create_time[11] = 0;
00072 }
00073 
00074 static void
00075 dumpCineonFileInfo(CineonFileInformation* fileInfo) {
00076     d_printf("\n--File Information--\n");
00077     d_printf("Magic: %8.8lX\n", (uintptr_t)ntohl(fileInfo->magic_num));
00078     d_printf("Image Offset %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(fileInfo->image_offset));
00079     d_printf("Generic Header size %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(fileInfo->gen_hdr_size));
00080     d_printf("Industry Header size %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(fileInfo->ind_hdr_size));
00081     d_printf("User Data size %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(fileInfo->user_data_size));
00082     d_printf("File size %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(fileInfo->file_size));
00083     d_printf("Version \"%s\"\n", fileInfo->vers);
00084     d_printf("File name \"%s\"\n", fileInfo->file_name);
00085     d_printf("Creation date \"%s\"\n", fileInfo->create_date);
00086     d_printf("Creation time \"%s\"\n", fileInfo->create_time);
00087 }

00089 static void
00090 fillCineonChannelInfo(CineonFile* cineon, CineonChannelInformation* chan, int des) {
00091 
00092     chan->designator1 = 0;
00093     chan->designator2 = des;
00094     chan->bits_per_pixel = 10;
00095     chan->pixels_per_line = htonl(cineon->width);
00096     chan->lines_per_image = htonl(cineon->height);
00097     chan->ref_low_data = htonl(0);
00098     chan->ref_low_quantity = htonf(0.0);
00099     chan->ref_high_data = htonl(1023);
00100     chan->ref_high_quantity = htonf(2.046);
00101 }
00102 
00103 static void
00104 dumpCineonChannelInfo(CineonChannelInformation* chan) {
00105     d_printf("  Metric selector: %d", chan->designator1);
00106     switch (chan->designator1) {
00107         case 0: d_printf(" (Universal)\n"); break;
00108         default: d_printf(" (Vendor specific)\n"); break;
00109     }
00110     d_printf("  Metric: %d,", chan->designator2);
00111     switch (chan->designator2) {
00112         case 0: d_printf(" B&W (printing density?)\n"); break;
00113         case 1: d_printf(" Red printing density\n"); break;
00114         case 2: d_printf(" Green printing density\n"); break;
00115         case 3: d_printf(" Blue printing density\n"); break;
00116         case 4: d_printf(" Red CCIR XA/11\n"); break;
00117         case 5: d_printf(" Green CCIR XA/11\n"); break;
00118         case 6: d_printf(" Blue CCIR XA/11\n"); break;
00119         default: d_printf(" (unknown)\n"); break;
00120     }
00121     d_printf("  Bits per pixel %d\n", chan->bits_per_pixel);
00122     d_printf("  Pixels per line %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(chan->pixels_per_line));
00123     d_printf("  Lines per image %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(chan->lines_per_image));
00124     d_printf("  Ref low data %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(chan->ref_low_data));
00125     d_printf("  Ref low quantity %f\n", ntohf(chan->ref_low_quantity));
00126     d_printf("  Ref high data %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(chan->ref_high_data));
00127     d_printf("  Ref high quantity %f\n", ntohf(chan->ref_high_quantity));
00128 }

00130 static void
00131 fillCineonImageInfo(CineonFile* cineon, CineonImageInformation* imageInfo) {
00132 
00133     imageInfo->orientation = 0;
00134     imageInfo->channels_per_image = cineon->depth;
00135 
00136     if (cineon->depth == 1) {
00137         fillCineonChannelInfo(cineon, &imageInfo->channel[0], 0);
00138 
00139     }
00140     else if (cineon->depth == 3) {
00141         fillCineonChannelInfo(cineon, &imageInfo->channel[0], 1);
00142         fillCineonChannelInfo(cineon, &imageInfo->channel[1], 2);
00143         fillCineonChannelInfo(cineon, &imageInfo->channel[2], 3);
00144     }
00145 
00146     imageInfo->white_point_x = htonf(undefined());
00147     imageInfo->white_point_y = htonf(undefined());
00148     imageInfo->red_primary_x = htonf(undefined());
00149     imageInfo->red_primary_y = htonf(undefined());
00150     imageInfo->green_primary_x = htonf(undefined());
00151     imageInfo->green_primary_y = htonf(undefined());
00152     imageInfo->blue_primary_x = htonf(undefined());
00153     imageInfo->blue_primary_y = htonf(undefined());
00154 
00155     strcpy(imageInfo->label, "David's Cineon writer.");
00156 
00157 }
00158 
00159 static void
00160 dumpCineonImageInfo(CineonImageInformation* imageInfo) {
00161 
00162     int i;
00163     d_printf("\n--Image Information--\n");
00164     d_printf("Image orientation %d,", imageInfo->orientation);
00165     switch (imageInfo->orientation) {
00166         case 0: d_printf(" LRTB\n"); break;
00167         case 1: d_printf(" LRBT\n"); break;
00168         case 2: d_printf(" RLTB\n"); break;
00169         case 3: d_printf(" RLBT\n"); break;
00170         case 4: d_printf(" TBLR\n"); break;
00171         case 5: d_printf(" TBRL\n"); break;
00172         case 6: d_printf(" BTLR\n"); break;
00173         case 7: d_printf(" BTRL\n"); break;
00174         default: d_printf(" (unknown)\n"); break;
00175     }
00176     d_printf("Channels %d\n", imageInfo->channels_per_image);
00177     for (i = 0; i < imageInfo->channels_per_image; ++i) {
00178         d_printf("  --Channel %d--\n", i);
00179         dumpCineonChannelInfo(&imageInfo->channel[i]);
00180     }
00181 
00182     d_printf("White point x %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->white_point_x));
00183     d_printf("White point y %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->white_point_y));
00184     d_printf("Red primary x %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->red_primary_x));
00185     d_printf("Red primary y %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->red_primary_y));
00186     d_printf("Green primary x %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->green_primary_x));
00187     d_printf("Green primary y %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->green_primary_y));
00188     d_printf("Blue primary x %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->blue_primary_x));
00189     d_printf("Blue primary y %f\n", ntohf(imageInfo->blue_primary_y));
00190     d_printf("Label \"%s\"\n", imageInfo->label);
00191 }

00193 static void
00194 fillCineonFormatInfo(CineonFile* cineon, CineonFormatInformation* formatInfo) {
00195 
00196     (void)cineon; /* unused */
00197     
00198     formatInfo->interleave = 0;
00199     formatInfo->packing = 5;
00200     formatInfo->signage = 0;
00201     formatInfo->sense = 0;
00202     formatInfo->line_padding = htonl(0);
00203     formatInfo->channel_padding = htonl(0);
00204 }
00205 
00206 static void
00207 dumpCineonFormatInfo(CineonFormatInformation* formatInfo) {
00208     d_printf("\n--Format Information--\n");
00209     d_printf("Interleave %d,", formatInfo->interleave);
00210     switch (formatInfo->interleave) {
00211         case 0: d_printf(" pixel interleave\n"); break;
00212         case 1: d_printf(" line interleave\n"); break;
00213         case 2: d_printf(" channel interleave\n"); break;
00214         default: d_printf(" (unknown)\n"); break;
00215     }
00216     d_printf("Packing %d,", formatInfo->packing);
00217     if (formatInfo->packing & 0x80) { 
00218         d_printf(" multi pixel,");
00219     }
00220     else {
00221         d_printf(" single pixel,");
00222     }
00223     switch (formatInfo->packing & 0x7F) {
00224         case 0: d_printf(" tight\n"); break;
00225         case 1: d_printf(" byte packed left\n"); break;
00226         case 2: d_printf(" byte packed right\n"); break;
00227         case 3: d_printf(" word packed left\n"); break;
00228         case 4: d_printf(" word packed right\n"); break;
00229         case 5: d_printf(" long packed left\n"); break;
00230         case 6: d_printf(" long packed right\n"); break;
00231         default: d_printf(" (unknown)\n"); break;
00232     }
00233     d_printf("Sign %d,", formatInfo->signage);
00234     if (formatInfo->signage) { 
00235         d_printf(" signed\n");
00236     }
00237     else {
00238         d_printf(" unsigned\n");
00239     }
00240     d_printf("Sense %d,", formatInfo->signage);
00241     if (formatInfo->signage) { 
00242         d_printf(" negative\n");
00243     }
00244     else {
00245         d_printf(" positive\n");
00246     }
00247     d_printf("End of line padding %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(formatInfo->line_padding));
00248     d_printf("End of channel padding %ld\n", (intptr_t)ntohl(formatInfo->channel_padding));
00249 }

00252 fillCineonOriginationInfo(CineonFile* cineon,
00253     CineonOriginationInformation* originInfo, CineonFileInformation* fileInfo) {
00254     
00255     (void)cineon; /* unused */
00256 
00257     originInfo->x_offset = htonl(0);
00258     originInfo->y_offset = htonl(0);
00259     strcpy(originInfo->file_name, fileInfo->file_name);
00260     strcpy(originInfo->create_date, fileInfo->create_date);
00261     strcpy(originInfo->create_time, fileInfo->create_time);
00262     strncpy(originInfo->input_device, "David's Cineon writer", 64);
00263     strncpy(originInfo->model_number, "Software", 32);
00264     strncpy(originInfo->serial_number, "001", 32);
00265     originInfo->x_input_samples_per_mm = htonf(undefined());
00266     originInfo->y_input_samples_per_mm =    htonf(undefined());
00267     /* this should probably be undefined, too */
00268     originInfo->input_device_gamma = htonf(1.0);
00269 }

00287 static int
00288 initCineonGenericHeader(CineonFile* cineon, CineonGenericHeader* header, const char* imagename) {
00289 
00290     fillCineonFileInfo(cineon, &header->fileInfo, imagename);
00291     fillCineonImageInfo(cineon, &header->imageInfo);
00292     fillCineonFormatInfo(cineon, &header->formatInfo);
00293     fillCineonOriginationInfo(cineon, &header->originInfo, &header->fileInfo);
00294 
00295     return 0;
00296 }
00297 
00298 static void
00299 UNUSED_FUNCTION(dumpCineonGenericHeader)(CineonGenericHeader* header) {
00300     dumpCineonFileInfo(&header->fileInfo);
00301     dumpCineonImageInfo(&header->imageInfo);
00302     dumpCineonFormatInfo(&header->formatInfo);
00303     dumpCineonOriginationInfo(&header->originInfo);
00304 }

00312 static void
00313 verboseMe(CineonFile* cineon) {
00314 
00315     d_printf("size %d x %d x %d\n", cineon->width, cineon->height, cineon->depth);
00316     d_printf("ImageStart %d, lineBufferLength %d, implied length %d\n",
00317         cineon->imageOffset, cineon->lineBufferLength * 4,
00318         cineon->imageOffset + cineon->lineBufferLength * 4 * cineon->height);
00319 }
00320 
00321 int
00322 cineonGetRowBytes(CineonFile* cineon, unsigned short* row, int y) {
00323 
00324     int longsRead;
00325     int pixelIndex;
00326     int longIndex;
00327     int numPixels = cineon->width * cineon->depth;
00328 
00329 
00330     /* only seek if not reading consecutive lines */
00331     if (y != cineon->fileYPos) {
00332         int lineOffset = cineon->imageOffset + y * cineon->lineBufferLength * 4;
00333         if (verbose) d_printf("Seek in getRowBytes\n");
00334         if (logimage_fseek(cineon, lineOffset, SEEK_SET) != 0) {
00335             if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't seek to line %d at %d\n", y, lineOffset);
00336             return 1;
00337         }
00338         cineon->fileYPos = y;
00339     }
00340 
00341     longsRead = logimage_fread(cineon->lineBuffer, 4, cineon->lineBufferLength, cineon);
00342     if (longsRead != cineon->lineBufferLength) {
00343         if (verbose) {
00344             d_printf("Couldn't read line %d length %d\n", y, cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00345             perror("cineonGetRowBytes");
00346         }
00347 
00348         return 1;
00349     }
00350 
00351     /* remember where we left the car, honey */
00352     ++cineon->fileYPos;
00353 
00354     /* convert longwords to pixels */
00355     pixelIndex = 0;
00356     for (longIndex = 0; longIndex < cineon->lineBufferLength; ++longIndex) {
00357         unsigned int t = ntohl(cineon->lineBuffer[longIndex]);
00358         t = t >> 2;
00359         cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex+2] = (unsigned short) t & 0x3ff;
00360         t = t >> 10;
00361         cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex+1] = (unsigned short) t & 0x3ff;
00362         t = t >> 10;
00363         cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex] = (unsigned short) t & 0x3ff;
00364         pixelIndex += 3;
00365     }
00366 
00367     /* extract required pixels */
00368     for (pixelIndex = 0; pixelIndex < numPixels; ++pixelIndex) {
00369         if (cineon->params.doLogarithm)
00370             row[pixelIndex] = cineon->lut10_16[cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex]];
00371         else
00372             row[pixelIndex] = cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex] << 6;
00373     }
00374 
00375     return 0;
00376 }
00377 
00378 int
00379 cineonSetRowBytes(CineonFile* cineon, const unsigned short* row, int y) {
00380 
00381     int pixelIndex;
00382     int numPixels = cineon->width * cineon->depth;
00383     int longIndex;
00384     int longsWritten;
00385 
00386     /* put new pixels into pixelBuffer */
00387     for (pixelIndex = 0; pixelIndex < numPixels; ++pixelIndex) {
00388         if (cineon->params.doLogarithm)
00389             cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex] = cineon->lut16_16[row[pixelIndex]];
00390         else
00391             cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex] = row[pixelIndex] >> 6;
00392     }
00393 
00394     /* pack into longwords */
00395     pixelIndex = 0;
00396     for (longIndex = 0; longIndex < cineon->lineBufferLength; ++longIndex) {
00397         unsigned int t =
00398                 (cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex] << 22) |
00399                 (cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex+1] << 12) |
00400                 (cineon->pixelBuffer[pixelIndex+2] << 2);
00401         cineon->lineBuffer[longIndex] = htonl(t);
00402         pixelIndex += 3;
00403     }
00404 
00405     /* only seek if not reading consecutive lines */
00406     if (y != cineon->fileYPos) {
00407         int lineOffset = cineon->imageOffset + y * cineon->lineBufferLength * 4;
00408         if (verbose) d_printf("Seek in setRowBytes\n");
00409         if (logimage_fseek(cineon, lineOffset, SEEK_SET) != 0) {
00410             if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't seek to line %d at %d\n", y, lineOffset);
00411             return 1;
00412         }
00413         cineon->fileYPos = y;
00414     }
00415 
00416     longsWritten = fwrite(cineon->lineBuffer, 4, cineon->lineBufferLength, cineon->file);
00417     if (longsWritten != cineon->lineBufferLength) {
00418         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't write line %d length %d\n", y, cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00419         return 1;
00420     }
00421 
00422     ++cineon->fileYPos;
00423 
00424     return 0;
00425 }
00426 
00427 int
00428 cineonGetRow(CineonFile* cineon, unsigned short* row, int y) {
00429 
00430     int longsRead;
00431     int pixelIndex;
00432     int longIndex;
00433 /*  int numPixels = cineon->width * cineon->depth;
00434 */
00435     /* only seek if not reading consecutive lines */
00436     if (y != cineon->fileYPos) {
00437         int lineOffset = cineon->imageOffset + y * cineon->lineBufferLength * 4;
00438         if (verbose) d_printf("Seek in getRow\n");
00439         if (logimage_fseek(cineon, lineOffset, SEEK_SET) != 0) {
00440             if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't seek to line %d at %d\n", y, lineOffset);
00441             return 1;
00442         }
00443         cineon->fileYPos = y;
00444     }
00445 
00446     longsRead = logimage_fread(cineon->lineBuffer, 4, cineon->lineBufferLength, cineon);
00447     if (longsRead != cineon->lineBufferLength) {
00448         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't read line %d length %d\n", y, cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00449         return 1;
00450     }
00451 
00452     /* remember where we left the car, honey */
00453     ++cineon->fileYPos;
00454 
00455     /* convert longwords to pixels */
00456     pixelIndex = 0;
00457     for (longIndex = 0; longIndex < cineon->lineBufferLength; ++longIndex) {
00458         unsigned int t = ntohl(cineon->lineBuffer[longIndex]);
00459         t = t >> 2;
00460         row[pixelIndex+2] = (unsigned short) t & 0x3ff;
00461         t = t >> 10;
00462         row[pixelIndex+1] = (unsigned short) t & 0x3ff;
00463         t = t >> 10;
00464         row[pixelIndex] = (unsigned short) t & 0x3ff;
00465         pixelIndex += 3;
00466     }
00467 
00468     return 0;
00469 }

00471 int
00472 cineonSetRow(CineonFile* cineon, const unsigned short* row, int y) {
00473 
00474     int pixelIndex;
00475 /*  int numPixels = cineon->width * cineon->depth;
00476 */  int longIndex;
00477     int longsWritten;
00478 
00479     /* pack into longwords */
00480     pixelIndex = 0;
00481     for (longIndex = 0; longIndex < cineon->lineBufferLength; ++longIndex) {
00482         unsigned int t =
00483                 (row[pixelIndex] << 22) |
00484                 (row[pixelIndex+1] << 12) |
00485                 (row[pixelIndex+2] << 2);
00486         cineon->lineBuffer[longIndex] = htonl(t);
00487         pixelIndex += 3;
00488     }
00489 
00490     /* only seek if not reading consecutive lines */
00491     if (y != cineon->fileYPos) {
00492         int lineOffset = cineon->imageOffset + y * cineon->lineBufferLength * 4;
00493         if (verbose) d_printf("Seek in setRowBytes\n");
00494         if (logimage_fseek(cineon, lineOffset, SEEK_SET) != 0) {
00495             if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't seek to line %d at %d\n", y, lineOffset);
00496             return 1;
00497         }
00498         cineon->fileYPos = y;
00499     }
00500 
00501     longsWritten = fwrite(cineon->lineBuffer, 4, cineon->lineBufferLength, cineon->file);
00502     if (longsWritten != cineon->lineBufferLength) {
00503         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't write line %d length %d\n", y, cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00504         return 1;
00505     }
00506 
00507     ++cineon->fileYPos;
00508 
00509     return 0;
00510 }
00511 
00512 CineonFile* 
00513 cineonOpen(const char* filename) {
00514 
00515     CineonGenericHeader header;
00516 
00517     CineonFile* cineon = (CineonFile* )malloc(sizeof(CineonFile));
00518     if (cineon == 0) {
00519         if (verbose) d_printf("Failed to malloc cineon file structure.\n");
00520         return 0;
00521     }
00522 
00523     /* for close routine */
00524     cineon->file = 0;
00525     cineon->lineBuffer = 0;
00526     cineon->pixelBuffer = 0;
00527     cineon->membuffer = 0;
00528     cineon->memcursor = 0;
00529     cineon->membuffersize = 0;
00530     
00531     cineon->file = BLI_fopen(filename, "rb");
00532     if (cineon->file == 0) {
00533         if (verbose) d_printf("Failed to open file \"%s\".\n", filename);
00534         cineonClose(cineon);
00535         return 0;
00536     }
00537     cineon->reading = 1;
00538 
00539     if (logimage_fread(&header, sizeof(CineonGenericHeader), 1, cineon) == 0) {
00540         if (verbose) d_printf("Not enough data for header in \"%s\".\n", filename);
00541         cineonClose(cineon);
00542         return 0;
00543     }
00544 
00545     /* let's assume cineon files are always network order */
00546     if (header.fileInfo.magic_num != ntohl(CINEON_FILE_MAGIC)) {
00547         if (verbose) d_printf("Bad magic number %8.8lX in \"%s\".\n",
00548             (uintptr_t)ntohl(header.fileInfo.magic_num), filename);
00549         cineonClose(cineon);
00550         return 0;
00551     }
00552 
00553     if (header.formatInfo.packing != 5) {
00554         if (verbose) d_printf("Can't understand packing %d\n", header.formatInfo.packing);
00555         cineonClose(cineon);
00556         return 0;
00557     }
00558 
00559     cineon->width = ntohl(header.imageInfo.channel[0].pixels_per_line);
00560     cineon->height = ntohl(header.imageInfo.channel[0].lines_per_image);
00561     cineon->depth = header.imageInfo.channels_per_image;
00562     /* cineon->bitsPerPixel = 10; */
00563     cineon->bitsPerPixel = header.imageInfo.channel[0].bits_per_pixel;
00564     cineon->imageOffset = ntohl(header.fileInfo.image_offset);
00565 
00566     cineon->lineBufferLength = pixelsToLongs(cineon->width * cineon->depth);
00567     cineon->lineBuffer = malloc(cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00568     if (cineon->lineBuffer == 0) {
00569         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't malloc line buffer of size %d\n", cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00570         cineonClose(cineon);
00571         return 0;
00572     }
00573 
00574     cineon->pixelBuffer = malloc(cineon->lineBufferLength * 3 * sizeof(unsigned short));
00575     if (cineon->pixelBuffer == 0) {
00576         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't malloc pixel buffer of size %d\n",
00577                 (cineon->width * cineon->depth) * (int)sizeof(unsigned short));
00578         cineonClose(cineon);
00579         return 0;
00580     }
00581     cineon->pixelBufferUsed = 0;
00582 
00583     if (logimage_fseek(cineon, cineon->imageOffset, SEEK_SET) != 0) {
00584         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't seek to image data at %d\n", cineon->imageOffset);
00585         cineonClose(cineon);
00586         return 0;
00587     }
00588     cineon->fileYPos = 0;
00589 
00590     logImageGetByteConversionDefaults(&cineon->params);
00591     setupLut(cineon);
00592 
00593     cineon->getRow = &cineonGetRowBytes;
00594     cineon->setRow = 0;
00595     cineon->close = &cineonClose;
00596 
00597     if (verbose) {
00598         verboseMe(cineon);
00599     }
00600 
00601     return cineon;
00602 }
00603 
00604 int cineonIsMemFileCineon(unsigned char *mem)
00605 {
00606     unsigned int num;
00607     memcpy(&num, mem, sizeof(unsigned int));
00608     
00609     if (num != ntohl(CINEON_FILE_MAGIC)) {
00610         return 0;
00611     }
00612     else return 1;
00613 }
00614 
00615 CineonFile* 
00616 cineonOpenFromMem(unsigned char *mem, unsigned int size) {
00617 
00618     CineonGenericHeader header;
00619     
00620     CineonFile* cineon = (CineonFile* )malloc(sizeof(CineonFile));
00621     if (cineon == 0) {
00622         if (verbose) d_printf("Failed to malloc cineon file structure.\n");
00623         return 0;
00624     }
00625 
00626     /* for close routine */
00627     cineon->file = 0;
00628     cineon->lineBuffer = 0;
00629     cineon->pixelBuffer = 0;
00630     cineon->membuffer = mem;
00631     cineon->membuffersize = size;
00632     cineon->memcursor = mem;
00633     
00634     cineon->file = 0;
00635     cineon->reading = 1;
00636     verbose = 0;
00637     if (size < sizeof(CineonGenericHeader)) {
00638         if (verbose) d_printf("Not enough data for header!\n");
00639         cineonClose(cineon);
00640         return 0;
00641     }
00642 
00643     logimage_fread(&header, sizeof(CineonGenericHeader), 1, cineon);
00644 
00645     /* let's assume cineon files are always network order */
00646     if (header.fileInfo.magic_num != ntohl(CINEON_FILE_MAGIC)) {
00647         if (verbose) d_printf("Bad magic number %8.8lX in\n", (uintptr_t)ntohl(header.fileInfo.magic_num));
00648 
00649         cineonClose(cineon);
00650         return 0;
00651     }
00652 
00653     if (header.formatInfo.packing != 5) {
00654         if (verbose) d_printf("Can't understand packing %d\n", header.formatInfo.packing);
00655         cineonClose(cineon);
00656         return 0;
00657     }
00658 
00659     cineon->width = ntohl(header.imageInfo.channel[0].pixels_per_line);
00660     cineon->height = ntohl(header.imageInfo.channel[0].lines_per_image);
00661     cineon->depth = header.imageInfo.channels_per_image;
00662     /* cineon->bitsPerPixel = 10; */
00663     cineon->bitsPerPixel = header.imageInfo.channel[0].bits_per_pixel;
00664     cineon->imageOffset = ntohl(header.fileInfo.image_offset);
00665 
00666     cineon->lineBufferLength = pixelsToLongs(cineon->width * cineon->depth);
00667     cineon->lineBuffer = malloc(cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00668     if (cineon->lineBuffer == 0) {
00669         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't malloc line buffer of size %d\n", cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00670         cineonClose(cineon);
00671         return 0;
00672     }
00673 
00674     cineon->pixelBuffer = malloc(cineon->lineBufferLength * 3 * sizeof(unsigned short));
00675     if (cineon->pixelBuffer == 0) {
00676         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't malloc pixel buffer of size %d\n",
00677                 (cineon->width * cineon->depth) * (int)sizeof(unsigned short));
00678         cineonClose(cineon);
00679         return 0;
00680     }
00681     cineon->pixelBufferUsed = 0;
00682     
00683     if (logimage_fseek(cineon, cineon->imageOffset, SEEK_SET) != 0) {
00684         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't seek to image data at %d\n", cineon->imageOffset);
00685         cineonClose(cineon);
00686         return 0;
00687     }
00688     
00689     cineon->fileYPos = 0;
00690 
00691     logImageGetByteConversionDefaults(&cineon->params);
00692     setupLut(cineon);
00693 
00694     cineon->getRow = &cineonGetRowBytes;
00695     cineon->setRow = 0;
00696     cineon->close = &cineonClose;
00697 
00698     if (verbose) {
00699         verboseMe(cineon);
00700     }
00701 
00702     return cineon;
00703 }

00706 int
00707 cineonGetSize(const CineonFile* cineon, int* width, int* height, int* depth) {
00708     *width = cineon->width;
00709     *height = cineon->height;
00710     *depth = cineon->depth;
00711     return 0;
00712 }
00713 
00714 CineonFile*
00715 cineonCreate(const char* filename, int width, int height, int depth) {
00716 
00717     /* Note: always write files in network order */
00718     /* By the spec, it shouldn't matter, but ... */
00719 
00720     CineonGenericHeader header;
00721     const char* shortFilename = 0;
00722 
00723     CineonFile* cineon = (CineonFile*)malloc(sizeof(CineonFile));
00724     if (cineon == 0) {
00725         if (verbose) d_printf("Failed to malloc cineon file structure.\n");
00726         return 0;
00727     }
00728 
00729     memset(&header, 0, sizeof(header));
00730 
00731     /* for close routine */
00732     cineon->file = 0;
00733     cineon->lineBuffer = 0;
00734     cineon->pixelBuffer = 0;
00735 
00736     cineon->file = BLI_fopen(filename, "wb");
00737     if (cineon->file == 0) {
00738         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't open file %s\n", filename);
00739         cineonClose(cineon);
00740         return 0;
00741     }
00742     cineon->reading = 0;
00743 
00744     cineon->width = width;
00745     cineon->height = height;
00746     cineon->depth = depth;
00747     cineon->bitsPerPixel = 10;
00748     cineon->imageOffset = sizeof(CineonGenericHeader);
00749 
00750     cineon->lineBufferLength = pixelsToLongs(cineon->width * cineon->depth);
00751     cineon->lineBuffer = malloc(cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00752     if (cineon->lineBuffer == 0) {
00753         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't malloc line buffer of size %d\n", cineon->lineBufferLength * 4);
00754         cineonClose(cineon);
00755         return 0;
00756     }
00757 
00758     cineon->pixelBuffer = malloc(cineon->lineBufferLength * 3 * sizeof(unsigned short));
00759     if (cineon->pixelBuffer == 0) {
00760         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't malloc pixel buffer of size %d\n",
00761                 (cineon->width * cineon->depth) * (int)sizeof(unsigned short));
00762         cineonClose(cineon);
00763         return 0;
00764     }
00765     cineon->pixelBufferUsed = 0;
00766 
00767     /* find trailing part of filename */
00768     shortFilename = strrchr(filename, '/');
00769     if (shortFilename == 0) {
00770         shortFilename = filename;
00771     }
00772     else {
00773         ++shortFilename;
00774     }
00775 
00776     if (initCineonGenericHeader(cineon, &header, shortFilename) != 0) {
00777         cineonClose(cineon);
00778         return 0;
00779     }
00780 
00781     if (fwrite(&header, sizeof(header), 1, cineon->file) == 0) {
00782         if (verbose) d_printf("Couldn't write image header\n");
00783         cineonClose(cineon);
00784         return 0;
00785     }
00786     cineon->fileYPos = 0;
00787 
00788     logImageGetByteConversionDefaults(&cineon->params);
00789     setupLut(cineon);
00790 
00791     cineon->getRow = 0;
00792     cineon->setRow = &cineonSetRowBytes;
00793     cineon->close = &cineonClose;
00794 
00795     return cineon;
00796 }
00797 
00798 void
00799 cineonClose(CineonFile* cineon) {
00800 
00801     if (cineon == 0) {
00802         return;
00803     }
00804 
00805     if (cineon->file) {
00806         fclose(cineon->file);
00807         cineon->file = 0;
00808     }
00809 
00810     if (cineon->lineBuffer) {
00811         free(cineon->lineBuffer);
00812         cineon->lineBuffer = 0;
00813     }
00814 
00815     if (cineon->pixelBuffer) {
00816         free(cineon->pixelBuffer);
00817         cineon->pixelBuffer = 0;
00818     }
00819 
00820     free(cineon);
00821 }
